meanings.definition: A dangerous, difficult, or otherwise unfortunate situation.
meanings.sent1: The hiker found himself in dire plights when he got lost in the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to help those in financial plights during the pandemic.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown found himself in comical plights as he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a shipwreck of emotional plights, lost in a sea of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The plights of the characters in the story left a lasting impact on the readers.

meanings.definition: To give or pledge (one's word or solemn promise).
meanings.sent1: She plights her loyalty to her best friend by always being there for her.
meanings.sent2: He plights his commitment to the project by working diligently every day.
meanings.sent3: The young knight plights his sword to defend the kingdom against all foes.
meanings.sent4: The bride and groom plighted their love in a beautiful ceremony under the stars.
meanings.sent5: The leader plights to lead with integrity and honesty in all decisions.

meanings.definition: To put or give in pledge.
meanings.sent1: He plights his family heirloom as collateral for the loan.
meanings.sent2: The nobleman plights his lands to secure the safety of his people.
meanings.sent3: The magician plights his magical staff to guarantee the success of his trick.
meanings.sent4: She plights her prized possession to show her dedication to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The artist plights his masterpiece as a symbol of his artistic vision.
